utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hello? Hello?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I LOVE MY NEW JOB!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey, you're screaming.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: YOU BET YOUR ASS I AM! I just had the best first day ever! The kitchen: twice as big as Allessandro's.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, that's great.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, a-a-and clean. Not just health department clean... Monica clean.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Awesome.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, and the people are so nice. There's this one guy, Geoffrey, he's the Maitre D., Chandler, you will love him. He is without a doubt, the funniest guy I have ever met.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: This is nice.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You need both hands for that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I kinda do. Well, how's this?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Aaahhh, look at you two... holding hands... huh is this getting serious? Have you not talked about it yet? Am I making you uncomfortable? If you were bigger you'd hit me, huh...? Aaaaaahhhhhh

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'm sorry... I'm sorry. It's obviously way too early for us to be... having that conversation.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Is it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Maybe not, is it?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Okay, when I got divorced, I didn't think I'd feel this way about someone for a really long time... Then again, I didn't think I'd meet someone like you... and... this may be crazy soon, but... I want you to have this... No, not... that's gum. Ooh, five bucks... I love it when that happens, you know... Think no note's there...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know Mike, why don't you keep digging?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Oh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, it's a key. To be honest, I think I'd prefer the five dollars.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: It's to my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh wow, ooh! Ooh, big step for Phoebe and Mike.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yeah, look, and I don't want you to feel like you have to give me your key just because...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no, I want to.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Oh, thank God.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah... ooh... wow... Even started to think I'd never meet someone that, you know, I wanted to... do this with. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Is this cool, huh?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It really is.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I know it... It is amazing these little things open doors... huh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So I don't go back to work for another four weeks, but we would like our nanny to start right away, so that Emma could get a chance to know her.

utterance.speaker: Nanny Candidate
utterance.content: I think that's really smart. The easier we can make the transition for her, the better.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That's great, great. So do you have any questions for us?

utterance.speaker: Nanny Candidate
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right. Well thank you so much for coming...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really nice to meet you... and we'll call you.

utterance.speaker: Nanny Candidate
utterance.content: Oh, you know, wait. I do have one question. Do you guys do random drug testing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Boy, we uhm... hadn't really thought of that.

utterance.speaker: Nanny Candidate
utterance.content: That's cool. But... but if you do, I'm gonna need three days notice.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okidoki! Wow! We're never gonna find a nanny.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, come on Rach, we will. I promise. We have more interviews And worse comes to worse, we can always reconsider the uhm... the first one we met with.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What, the blonde with no bra?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She was blonde? Just a sec.! Okay, okay. This one's name is Sandy. She's got a degree in early childhood education, uhm... she worked for her last family for three years.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay...

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Hi... I'm Sandy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And she's a little mannish...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! David!

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Hi! I-i-is this a bad time?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! It's a great time, come in...! WOW, hi... Oh my gosh! What are you doing here? Are you back from Minsk?

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Well, just for a couple of days, uhm... I'm here to explain to the people who gave us our grant, why it's a positive thing that we spent all their money and uhm... accomplished uhm... nothing.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Who cares, it got you here.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Well, it got me to New York anyway, and then I got on a cab at the airport, and the guy said where to? and I just... gave him your address I... I... I didn't even think about it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow. Where is your luggage?

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Damn it!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: A-All right, well... I'll call the cab company.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Wa... wa... wait! We can... call them later. Can you just... just stand there f-f-for a moment? Boy! There's an old Russian expression, uhm... it goes: Schto ya ztez vigul... ui! Roughly translated that means uhm... This thing that I'm looking at: wow!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thank you! God, no! You should see me when... Oh actually, no, I look pretty good.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Are... are you kidding? You know, when you don't see someone for a long time, a-a-and you kind of build them up in your head and you start thinking about: Come on, don't be crazy. Nobody is that beautiful, but... well, you are. Well, so, uhm... are you seeing... anyone?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'm... I'm just... I'm the worst person ever. How can I not tell David that I'm seeing Mike?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Maybe he didn't give you a chance.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He said: Are you seeing someone? And I said no...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, well... That had been your window.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! I mean, I don't know. I was just , I was looking, I was looking in his eyes and I was just thinking: Oh my God! It's David. David's here. He's just, he's so irresistible.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really? The scientist guy?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really? Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Continue...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.Okay, then it gets worse, 'cause then I told him that I would see him tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know! Evil! And... and... and... I like Mike so much, you know. It's just going really well. Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow, isn't it ironic that David would show up on the same day that you and Mike exchange keys?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uhuh... Yeah...!, you know. And given my life long search for irony, you can imagine how happy I am.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I mean I guess, I just have to... tell David that nothing can happen between us. Unless I don't... You know, complicated moral situation, no right, no wrong...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You have to tell David!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I knew I should have had this conversation with Joey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Funniest guy she's ever met! I'm funny, right...? What do you know, you're a door... You just like knock-knock jokes... Save it for inside!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Heeeeeey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So... Oklahoma is a crazy place. You know, they call it the Sooner state. Frankly I'd sooner be in any other state. And what's with Oklahoma having a pan handle? Can all states have stuff like that? Hey yeah, I'm from the waistband, Wyoming. But when I was seven, we headed over to the crotch.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Was your cabin pressurised?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And don't get me started on the way that people from Tulsa talk.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What's with the word y'all? You know, just... two words just... pushed together... Are we all allowed to do that, because if so, I say why stop there? You know, your new poodle could be your noodle. And fried chicken? Could be fricken.Waiter, waiter excuse me, I'll have the fricken? See, that's... that's funny with the fricken, right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, it just remind me of something this guy did today at work. I told you about that funny guy, Geoffrey, right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, he came up...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, he did this bit... You probably had to be there, but it was Liza Minelli locked in our freezer, eating a raw chicken.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Were you there?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, but it sounds like it was fricken funny...

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: I really do understand how hard it's gotta be to leave your child with another person. I mean, it's leaving behind a piece of your heart...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sandy, that's exactly what it is...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are you gay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: It's okay. I get that a lot doing what I do. But I am straight. I-I'm engaged actually.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Her name is Deliah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, that's pretty.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So you're just like a... guy who's a nanny?

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: I realise how it's... a bit unorthodox for some people, but I really believe, the most satisfying thing you can do with your life, is take care of a child.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Like in my last job, I met Daniel when he was three weeks old. And I got to watch him grow into this awesome person... When I left, I said: I'll see you soon... And he said to me: Skdandy... That was his name for me... I'll see you every day... right in...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, kids say all kinds of crap.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God, she mu... she must need her diaper changed.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Oh, oh, I can do it for her, if you want...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, that would be great! I love him, I love him, I love him...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Rach, he's a guy!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So wh..? He's smart, he's qualified. Give me one good reason we shouldn't try him out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Because, it's weird!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What kind of job is that for a man? A nanny? I-It's like if a woman wanted to be...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: King?

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: I er... I hope you don't mind. I used some of my home-made lotion on Emma. It's a mixture of calendula and honey cream. It'll dry that rash right up. Plus... it keeps the hands young...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Please? YES! Sandy you're hired.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: That's great! I'm sorry. It's just... such an emotional thing when you're welcomed into a new family...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oooh... wow, come here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You gotta be at least bi...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! I need you to set me up for a joke. Later, when Monica is around, I need you to ask me about fire trucks.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh. I-I don't know Chan. I'm not so good with remembering lines.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, thank God your livelihood doesn't depend on it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know, right? Wh... Wh... Why are we doing this?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica says that her Maitre D. is the funniest guy she's ever met.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Seriously? She actually said that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes! Am I crazy to be this upset?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nooooo! Being funny is your thing!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Without that, you just got "lame with women".

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi! There you are.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fire trucks!

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Wow, you look even... more beautiful than you did yesterday.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oof...

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: In fact, ehm... I going to kiss you now.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, wait, wait!

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Yeah, I-I don't, I can't get away with stuff like that. I-I-It sounded sexy in my head, so I...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no, it's not that. Uhm... Remember when you asked me if I was seeing someone and I said no? Well, uhm... I am. His ... his name is Mike.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Oh... oh...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I should have told you.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: No... well, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Well, i-it's okay. I-I-I understand... Well, s... well, are you happy with this guy?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I am happy.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Damn it! I-I'm sorry. I-I don't mean that. I-I want you to be happy... But only with me. No, uhm... that's not fair. Uh, who cares, leave him!. Oh, I don't mean that. Yes I do... I'm sorry Uhm, I... I think I should probably uhm... go...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well... but David, just... I just want you to know that... that... you know... telling you this... is one of the hardest things I've ever had to do.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Well... just so you know... hearing it wasn't exactly a Vladnik carnival either... Can we at least hug goodbye?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Of course, yeah. You know, a kiss on the cheek wouldn't be totally inappropriate...

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: No... no...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I mean...

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: In Minsk...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: ...it's uhm... i-it's two on each cheek and uhm... and one on the lips.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, if that's what they do in Minsk... In New York... it's...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh... Oh boy... Hi...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Is everything All right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah, it's fine, it's fine. Sandy was just... was just telling me about how he proposed to his fianc閑 and it was just sooo beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Well, her favourite flower is the camellia. >From the poem...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can't... I can't hear it again.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: You know, I can't tell it again...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And I'm fine never having heard it... Rach, can I... can I see you for a sec?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! Excuse me...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Do you realise that man has cried in our apartment three times...? Huh? I haven't cried that many times since I moved in.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look, Ross, he's just... Sandy is just sensitive, that's all.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, okay, see... that... that is the problem. He is too sensitive.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What...? Too sensitive to take care of our baby?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean, all things that guy... These are amazing!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sandy made Madeleines.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This... this is exactly what I'm talking about. What kind of a guy makes... makes... delicate French cookies, huh? They're not even... butch, manly cookies with... with... you know with... with chunks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I... you know, I-I-I don't know what to say... I mean, I never thought of you as a guy who needed his men to be men. You know, 'cause I gotta tell you Ross, it not like you just came in from branding cattle.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey... there's sensitive... and there is too sensitive.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, what? What is too sensitive?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hmmm... No, no... No, I can't do this. It's bad.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: But... I-I-It's nice... A-a-and... nice is good. A-a-and good is not bad, ergo, w-w-we should keep kissing.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no. No.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: But... ergo...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Look David, if... if you had never left, then... yeah, we'd probably still be together right now, but... you did leave, and I-I'm with Mike and I really care about him...

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Uhm... uhm... Goodbye... Uh... Schto ya ztez vigul... ui...

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Well... hey, the key works...!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And you thanks for the face massage. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Did Rachel tell you we hired a male nanny?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah! I think that's great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh really? Did she tell you he plays the recorder, recites poetry and bakes Madeleines?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh... How are they?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Lighter than air... But that's not the point.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey...! Rachel and I hired a male nanny.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really...? Guys do that...? That's... weird...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That's like a woman wanting to be a...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...a what? A what? What's the end of that sentence?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes... What is the end of that sentence?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uhm... A penis model. Anyway, hey... Did you tell Chandler that some guy from work is the funniest guy you've ever met?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really? Do you not know Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is that why he's acting so weird...? He's jealous...? Oh my God, that is crazy. It's not like I'm attracted to Geoffrey...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So what? Being funny is Chandler's thing... You know, like Ross's thing is...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Science...? Academia...? Being a good father...?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can't believe he's that upset about this...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Monica, you have to do some damage control here, okay. 'Cause he's feeling like...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Heeeyy! Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you guys talking about?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uhm... Rachel and I hired a male nanny.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You got a man who's a nanny...? You got a manny...?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know, I don't mind a... male nanny, but I do draw the line at a male wetnurse.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohhh, ooohhh... you are on a roll, mister!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: If I'd known you guys were coming over, I would have brought more pizza.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, okay... Chandler you... you stop it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What is so funny about that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I don't know... I-It's... just the way you say it... I mean, you're funny... You have that funny thing. You're a funny guy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did you tell her what we talked about?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah....

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So those were pity laughs? PITY LAUGHS?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, listen... You have nothing to worry about with Geoffrey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah? Is he funnier than me?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, you're... you're different funny... I mean, you're... you're more sarcastic a-a-and... well, he does... bits... and impressions... and... and limericks...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I do limericks... uhm... There once was a man named Chandler, whose wife made him die inside.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, you know I think you're hilarious! Come on, you know that joke you told me last week? The one about Jerry Lewis and the girl with the lazy eye...? That slayed me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey... I made up that joke and told it to you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Not knowing when to shut up...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yep! That's my thing...

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: So... how many guys have your key?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no... It's not... it's not... i'ts not as bad as it looks... really. I was just saying goodbye to an old friend.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Your lipstick's on his mouth.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Oh, uh... we just uh... happen to wear the same shade.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, uhm... David and I did use to go out... but years ago, and he lives in Minsk. He's only... he's only in town for a couple of days.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Did you uhm...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no...

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: ...kiss him?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, well, yeah...

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Yes, but uhm... You should know... she really likes you. I-In fact I-I-I don't think you realise j-just how lucky you are fella.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Don't point your finger at me.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Why? Wh-What are you going to do about it?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Well... I'll... just show you what I'm gonna do about it...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Stop it! Stop it, before someone gets really hurt! Here David, you should just go.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: All right... But... if I ever do come back from Minsk... well, you just better watch out.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Well, if I ever goto Minsk, you'd better watch out.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Oh, you're going to Minsk?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Well, I might.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Really? Well, if you do, come in the spring. It's just lovely there.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, well... guys?

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Right... Goodbye Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Hey, what are you kidding me?

utterance.content: Right-o, right-o... Take good care of her.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I'm so sorry. If you... If you want your key back, I totally understand.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: It's never gonna happen again right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Right! Never! Never! I swear!

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: I-I... Oh I...I just wanna say uhm... if you do ever come to Minsk, that's my number We'll uhm... we'll party up Vladnik style.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! All right! Hey, hey Ross. Check it out! Sandy taught me Hot-cross Buns.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really? Sounded like Three Blind Mice.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Noooo... Three Blind Mice goes like this...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I swear to God...!

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Who's up for puppets?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Me! I'm up for puppets!

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Well, please welcome... The Snufflebumps... Who wants to be mr. Wigglemunch and who's gonna be the Grumpus?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, okay... How exactly is a two month old supposed to appreciate puppets?

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Actually studies have shown that the movement and colours help their cerebral development... The whimsical characters are just for us.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I wanna be Mr. Wigglemunch.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Well, I guess we know who's gonna be the Grumpus...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That was kind of rude!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry. Please apologise to Sandy and the Snufflebumps for me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know, he was just doing his job...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, you know what... I-I'm sorry I'm the only one who isn't in love with Gary Poppins out there... But I just... I can't... I can't go through with this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, come on Ross...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! Hey, you know what? I'm sorry. I would never force you... to hire someone you were this uncomfortable with...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh... That's true.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, you're the one who wants to fire him, so you're gonna have to do it.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: So you see Wigglemunch, that's why it's important to shaaaaaaare...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I am learning so much from you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I'm off to Tulsa, so if your Maitre D. friend has any funny Oklahoma jokes, tell him to e-mail me at www.hahanotsomuch.com.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, you can relax. Last night at work, Geoffrey told this really sexist joke. After that, not so funny anymore.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really...? See... that's the thing: you gotta keep it smart, people!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, don't miss that flight. You know I love you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I love you too. And... I like you as a friend.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right. See you later!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See ya!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Did that guy really make that joke?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Naaaa... He still kills me. Last night he had me laughing so hard, I swear... a little pee came out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Here goes...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can't watch. It's like firing Elmo.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sandy... Hi, we uhm... we kinda need to talk. I'm afraid it's not working out.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Oh...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, uhm... I mean, Rachel and I, think you are great... with Emma... uhm... We just feel...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: YOU! You feel!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I... just feel that the... the chemistry isn't right. I'm sorry. We're... we're more than happy to give you good recommendation...

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no... That's okay. I got a lot of offers from other families. I just picked you guys because... I liked you the best.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, damn you Geller!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Anyway, uhm...Well, I'm glad there's no hard feelings.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: No, none at all. You need to be happy with whoever is in your home... Although if you don't mind telling me, what was your problem? Maybe it's something I can work on in the future.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, you know, it's uhm... nothing you did, it's... it's uhm... my issue.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: What is it...? Please...?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know, I'm just not uhm... that comfortable with a guy who's as sensitive as you.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: That's fair... Although, can I ask... why do you think that is?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why... I... I don't know. Uhm... errrr... maybe... maybe because of my father?

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: hmmm...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I mean, uhm... you know when I was growing up he was kind of a tough guy... You know a-a-and as a kid I wasn't the athlete I am now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Huh ha ha!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I play squash...! Anyway, uhm... I uhm... I always get the feeling he thought I was too sensitive.

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: That must have been hard.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It was hard... I remember... I was in my bedroom... playing with my dinosaurs... playing and learning... and my father walks in and says... he says... "What are you doing with those things? What's wrong with you, why aren't you... why aren't you outside playing like a... like a real boy?

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: But you are a real boy!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know I am! ...And when it's summer, and it's hot, why can't you wear a tank top?

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: It's All right! Crying is good. It lets the boo-hoos out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Here come some more...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! You blow my mind...

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Oh, I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Aaahh... How much do I owe you?

utterance.speaker: Sandy
utterance.content: Twenty bucks.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It's like the cheapest college ever.
